_header: For age is a page / For the court full unmeet
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 417; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 411; for a carol that precedes as prefatory lines see 6055.
_description: John Skelton, ‘Why come ye nat to Courte?’ — 1248 lines in ‘skeltonics’

BodRawC813.First Lines: For age is a page For the courte full vnmete…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…Thys ys the tener of my bylla dawcoke ye be and Soo shalbe
                    styll
